fields.description:
export page is unusable for large spaces , and does not reflect tree structure.

Need to be able to export from parent down , and have a simpler way to control what is exported , not by using 200 tick boxes....

fields.description:
We will need to delegate the management of spaces to the project lead, or other team member , and the user management can not be centralised.

In Jira at the mo we end up with tens of jira-admins  which is a real problem.

The space needs to be as aindependent as possible.
fields.summary: space admin needs to be able to add users

fields.description:
displays comments , and generaly produces strange results.
( large empty spaces )
fields.summary: html-include macro broken
Separate the icons of "Rename Page" and "Move Page"

fields.description:
I suppose "Get a real database" is out of the question?

This disables: 
* user deletion (can't do the queries to find what content a user owns)
* orphaned page report
* undefined page report
fields.summary: MySQL doesn't support sub-selects

fields.description:
All of the hot referrers for my page are links to times I've edited it, like: 

https://jira.company.com/confluence/pages/doeditpage.action?spaceKey=TWA&title=Push+Status
https://jira.company.com/confluence/pages/editpage.action?spaceKey=TWA&title=Push+Status


I don't think those should qualify as referrers.
fields.summary: Hot Referrers includes editing links
create a panel macro

fields.description: add a titleBar=true|false option to rss macro to display/hide the feed titlebar
fields.summary: add a titleBar=true|false  option to rss macro

fields.description:
When I follow these steps:
 1) edit a page
 2) click preview
 3) click confirm

Confluence tells me:
"You were editing an outdated verion of this page. Another user has updated this page before you. Your changes against the now udpated version is shown below. Please decide whether your changes should overwrite it or you wish to discard your changes."

It then shows me all the changes I've just made and previewed, even though nobody else is editing the page at all.
fields.summary: Preview & Confirm is always telling me the page is outdated

fields.description:
URL: /display/SPACEKEY/2003/12/23 (also able to be internally linked)

If there are no posts for the day, provide forward and back links to the  nearest posts in either direction?

Remember to fix breadcrumbs.vm :)
fields.summary: Blog Post Daily View

fields.description: Global and per-space
fields.summary: Recent Blog Posts RSS feed
Edit/delete blog posts

fields.description:
Exporting a page to HTML dies with the following exception:

com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: java.io.IOException: Stream closed at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.doExportEntity(HtmlExporter.java:212) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.exportPage(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:143) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.doExport(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:109) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.doExport(HtmlExporter.java:43) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultImportExportManager.exportAs(DefaultImportExportManager.java:75) at

which has a nested exception of:

java.io.IOException: Stream closed at java.io.BufferedInputStream.ensureOpen(BufferedInputStream.java:120) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(BufferedInputStream.java:199) at com.atlassian.confluence.util.FileUtils.copyFile(FileUtils.java:67) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.HtmlExporter.doExportEntity(HtmlExporter.java:208) ... 65 more
fields.summary: HTML export is broken

fields.description:
The backup importer checks whether an import is incremental or full by looking if the backup starts with "export-"

Ideally, this should be decided by something inside the file, since the filename is kinda untrustworthy.
fields.summary: Renaming backup files is dangerous

fields.description: The page a {search} macro is included on will _always_ contain the search-term, because it's in the macro. Thus, it's a meaningless search-result.
fields.summary: Search macro should exclude page it's included on

fields.description:
Add a refactoring - make all links on page children.
especially when importing a lot of content from snipsnap
you want to start using the conf structure.
fields.summary: Add a refactoring - make all links on page children

fields.description: would like to give the block macro ( currently misnamed nofromat, what is noformat ?  this macro clearly formats it's content , so please call ut block before there are issues with backward compatibility) a title ( see attached picture )
fields.summary: Add title parameter to noformat macro ( and you can rename it at the same time to 'block' )

fields.description: {rss:url=myrssurl|maxEntries=5}
fields.summary: Add Max Entries parameter to rss macro

fields.description: It would be nice if there was a feature to import data/pages from UseModWiki - a very used Wiki on the web: http://www.usemod.com/
fields.summary: UseMod Wiki importer

fields.description: eg. @MON_START@ doesn't highlight at all whereas @MONSTART@ does.
fields.summary: template variables with an underscore in the name don't highlight properly

fields.description: jiraissues macro does not display due column
fields.summary: jiraissues macro does not display due column

fields.description:
I would like to see Confluence track and maintain versions of attachments much like it currently maintains versions of the page itself.

Use Case:
When using Confluence as a software project tool, we attach requirements documents, specification documents, example data files, prototype screenshots, etc...
During the design phase these documents are going to change regularly.  
Some of the time it is necessary to retrieve older versions of the documents to figure out why a certain decision was made.  Sometimes you'll need to go back to an earlier version of the document because a design change means you need to rollback and use older specs, prototypes, etc.
fields.summary: Attachment versioning

fields.description: Moving a page between spaces should warn you if the page has a parent and children and remove those relationships on the move.
fields.summary: Moving page doesn't break parent/child relationships

fields.description:
Froze the confluence webapp.

A person trying the webapp had the RSS feed pointed back at the space.

If it's not that, the uploading an XSLT as an attachement froze the confluence
fields.summary: RSS macro can loop on itself

fields.description:
At the moment, it seems that if you edit a page and take longer than maybe a minute to edit it, you get a page edited conflict screen - even though there _is_ no conflict.

We need to fix this, it's annoying and looks bad!
fields.summary: Edit Page Conflicts is buggy - often seems to detect conflicts which aren't there

fields.description:
The single word diff rendering needs more testing, it often seems to get confused.

One example:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=412&originalVersion=13&revisedVersion=14
fields.summary: Single word diff rendering is buggy

fields.description:
I just noticed that after upgrading to the latest code in CVS which mostly included the new Blog feature modifications, all the space-page relations are deleted! Looking at the local database, the entire "SpaceID" field value in "Content" table is NULL. And it's causing a lot of problems...

Deleting the whole config and starting from scratch is all fine and the new pages and spaces getting created have the relation there and all correct! So the only problem is with old data already in db.
fields.summary: Page-Space relation is corrupted after latest upgrade (blog related table modifications)

fields.description: Put a text-entry box on the edit page for a short one-line description of the change that can then appear on the 'diff' listing pages, and in the mails that get sent out.
fields.summary: Change summary input box on edit page

fields.description: When editing a page, have an option to say "I'm only making minor changes to the page, don't mail out notifications". That way you don't get mailbombed by people fixing typos or changing words into links.
fields.summary: "minor edit" button

fields.description:
Works
* [Middleware Configuration]
* [Core Collection Drivers]
** [JDBC Driver]
*** [JDBC Collection Driver]
*** [JDBC Metadata Driver]
**** [JDBC Template Report Configuration]
**** [JDBC URL Report Configuration]
**** [Generating Reports from JSP and other sources]
*** [JDBC Query Driver]

fails (renders generating with three ***):
* [Middleware Configuration]
* [Core Collection Drivers]
** [JDBC Driver]
*** [JDBC Collection Driver]
*** [JDBC Metadata Driver]
**** [JDBC Template Report Configuration]
**** [JDBC URL Report Configuration]
***** [Generating Reports from JSP and other sources]
*** [JDBC Query Driver]
fields.summary: Lists only work to 4 levels

fields.description:
If I write this:

* *test*
** *deeper test*

Confluence doesn't render the "deeper test" item.
fields.summary: Deeper item in list can't be bold

fields.description: When I push the back button instead of the "Re-Edit" button in a page preview, I'm losing all my changes. The problem occurs only on IE 6.0.
fields.summary: Back button "rollbacks" changes when previewing a page

fields.description: When the space summary is set as the default page for the space, clicking the "home" link on that page takes you to... the summary.
fields.summary: Home link on summary page goes to... summary.

fields.description:
eg:

CONF-453@jira  doesn't tell me too much about what the link is for.

What would be better is if I could have a JIRA icon, then CONF-453 as the link, and then "JIRA issue CONF-453" as the title for that link.
fields.summary: Shortcut Links should have title & display values

fields.description: It didn't force me to enter the admin email!
fields.summary: Form rules on 'Create Admin Account' during setup!

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a child page under a Space's Home page
2. Then remove this page
3. Now add re-add this same page (same title, parent and content)
4. In trying to add this page you will get this error message: 
"The page specified does not exist."

You will also see two occurrences of this file appear in the child listing in the parent Home page (that aren't accessible)
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't like it when I re-add a deleted child page

fields.description: ..., as it's done on dashboard

fields.description:
At the moment you cannot edit the site description (top left of the dashboard) - this should be a small snippet of Wiki text. Doesn't need to be searchable or anything, just rendered - so we can store it in the ConfluenceSetup as a block of text.

If the block doesn't exist, then show the default block as we have it now ("Welcome to Confluence... ")
fields.summary: Site description

fields.description: When you get a space description link in a search result, it will take you to the space homepage instead if your preference is to see the homepage as the front-page of the space: and that page will likely not contain the thing you were searching for.
fields.summary: Space description links don't take you to the space description

fields.description: Users added through the snipsnap importer are not added to the confluence-users group.
fields.summary: SnipSnap import does not add users to confluence-users

fields.description: "This file is an XML representation of some issues" is more confusing than it's worth, IMHO.
fields.summary: Remove blurb from {jiraissues} header.

fields.description: See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Release%2BNotes%2B1.0b3
fields.summary: Internal anchor links have the external link icon

fields.description:
If you {include:Foo}, then follow it with {children}, the children macro will list the children of the Foo page, not the containing page.

See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Release%2BNotes?showChildren=true#children
fields.summary: {include} macro confuses {children} macro.

fields.description: This will be able to be used by all components that need to display untrusted HTML: including HTML attachments, RSS feeds, and the html-include macro.
fields.summary: Add a generic HTML cleaning service

fields.description: Replace -- surrounded by whitespace with – and --- with —
fields.summary: — and – filters

fields.description: When you rename a page, going to the URL of the old page should result in a "301 Moved Permanently" redirect to the new page. (Obviously, the redirect should stop if a new page is then created in that location)
fields.summary: Renaming a page should leave behind an HTTP redirect

fields.description: Even (or maybe especially) after re-indexing: http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?query=jira
fields.summary: Search includes old versions of pages

fields.description:
If you go to: 
http://extranet.atlassian.com:8080/display/OWEN/Owen%2BFellows%2BTimesheets

I rename the second link
Timesheet from 12th January to 25th January
from 20030112 to 20040112 (because i forgot what year it was).

The incoming links were not picked up.
So i renamed i back to 20030112, when i go to rename again the incoming links are still not picked up.
Also when i try to rename to 20040112 it says the page already exists in the space.  (Which it obviously doesn't)
fields.summary: Problem with rename

fields.description:
If you go to:
http://extranet.atlassian.com:8080/display/OWEN/Owen%2BFellows%2BTimesheets

There are two links,
When you click on the links neither page shows the incoming page.
fields.summary: Problem with incoming links

fields.description: Frequently, I've been getting importer errors because the "destinationPageTitle" of a link has been null. Fixing this involves manually editing the entities.xml file in the dump, finding all links with destinationPageTitle's with values if [CDATA[]] or [CDATA[   ]] and so on, and deleting them before importing...
fields.summary: Export from data originating in beta1 may be unimportable in beta2

fields.description:
After completing the setup steps, something is not fully configured. This causes problems that persist until the first full restart:

* users not being fully saved (vanishing after the restart)
* exceptions editing user profiles [CONF-360]
* occasional errors importing data

The workaround is to fully restart Confluence after completing the setup steps.
fields.summary: Confluence not fully set up until first restart

fields.description: Macros like the RSS macro and the JIRA issues macro actualy cache their contents. We should add a refresh icon (we have a nice one) to the top right corner of any caching macro, and clicking this causes the macro to refresh when the page reloads (perhaps something like ?macro.refresh=true is added to the URL, and the macros catch that and refresh their content)
fields.summary: Add refresh icon + ability to any caching macro

fields.description:
See http://extranet.atlassian.com:8080/display/CONFDEV/Beta%2BRelease%2B2%2BTasks#jiratasks - the JIRA issues macro is generating lots of carriage returns, which I think our filter is then turning in to
and

tags, which get put all at the top of the table?
fields.summary: Too much white space generated?

fields.description:
the HTML emails seem to be missing a macro (or maybe it was never written?)

#emailUserLink (mike)
fields.summary: HTML emails contain #emailUserLink (mike)

fields.description: When you create a link in a space description like [Home] the handleMatch in the link regex class blows up. Relative links in space descriptions should go to other pages in their space, but regardless this should never blow up with an NPE :)
fields.summary: Space descriptions can't contain links in their space

fields.description: See http://extranet.atlassian.com:8080/display/CONFDEV/Home
fields.summary: Incoming links from space descriptions buggy

fields.description:
For example

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting%2BUp%2BConfluence

links to multiple missing pages?
fields.summary: Some links in the documentation site are "create new page" links

fields.description: Create a macro to include one page within another, at the moment this will only include pages from the same space.
fields.summary: {include:page} macro

fields.description:
(Can't access the admin of the demo and haven't installed the beta so I don't know if this really is a new feature.)

If we started using Confluence, we'd need to be able to customize the page templates so that the software looks like our brand. This isn't critical for the web interface (although important for extranet use) but is an absolute must for the page exports, especially PDF exporting. Othervise we can't really utilize the exporting for generating documents for third parties.

Editing the templates should be possible in the web admin without restarting the application so that fine-tuning the template is possible without major hassle. Also the templates should of course be saved with exports (and backups). If the template editing requires the IT admins to edit files on the server used to host Conf with graphic designers, the template editing is next to useless.

It should be possible to have multiple templates and be able to choose among the templates when exporting and possibly on space-basis for the web interface.
fields.summary: Page templates should be editable on the web interface and saved in exports

Armond222: or page list ...space list and whatever list too ?
bookmarkman_99: for search results first
bookmarkman_99: then page list
bookmarkman_99: I think the page list should be paginated, but should also have alphabetical index at the top - ie A | B | C | D... | Y | Z | 0-9
bookmarkman_99: so if you know page starts with B you can skip right there

fields.description:
The JIRA macro rocks, but it would be better if you could select the columns to display.

I'm thinking something like:

{jira:url=http://|columns=reporter,type,key,summary}

which displays those 4 columns in that order. By default it displays the columns we have now.

fields.description:
bookmarkman_99: we need to add caching to the junit macro (looking at file timestamps I guess?)
Armond222: you mean i download the whole then check the timestamp ?
bookmarkman_99: uhm... hrm... good question
bookmarkman_99: not sure :)
Armond222: we won't get a lot
bookmarkman_99: well maybe just cahce it for an hour
bookmarkman_99: and supply a link to refresh caches somehow
Armond222: only avoiding local parsing overhead
Armond222: and it's not that much
Armond222: that's more logical
Armond222: like what we're doing for RSS
bookmarkman_99: ok, cache for an hour, and provide a (small) 'refresh' link that maybe refreshes all macros or something
bookmarkman_99: ?refresh.macros=true on the URL
bookmarkman_99: or something

fields.description:
bookmarkman_99: uhm, JIRA macro
Armond222: should i talk directly with JIRA XmlRPC module for getting information ?
bookmarkman_99: talk to the JIRA RSS feed
bookmarkman_99: so you provide a URL, just like the RSS macro
bookmarkman_99: except with JIRA we display a lot more information
bookmarkman_99: and we can link to icons etc
bookmarkman_99: because we know what JIRA URLs look like :)
Armond222: aha
Armond222: good
Armond222: do the RSS feeds need any permission ?
Armond222: i mean should the user be logged in ?
Armond222: (JIRA i mean)
bookmarkman_99: if they should, they can pass that on the URL too
bookmarkman_99: os_username=foo&os_password=bar
Armond222: ok so i won't provide any special macro parameters for user/pass
Armond222: all will be in URL
bookmarkman_99: try at first just getting a list of issues, with type icons or something
Armond222: should i provide many macros for dealing with different concepts on JIRA ?
Armond222: list of X, list of Y, list of Z and so on ?
bookmarkman_99: nope
bookmarkman_99: just {jiraissues:http:///.... }
bookmarkman_99: I think
Armond222: k

I edited an existing page and added a link
[Setting up CVS with public/private keys for ext users]

It should up with a plus next to it to auto create.
I clicked then link added some text and click Add.
The page just comes page with no error message.

I'm assuming you are using the same Action to create a new page and create a new page from link just hiding the input box.
This means when the page return the error is added to an input field that doesn't exists.
fields.summary: Error automatically creating pages with illegal names

fields.description:
Tried to link to a page with ampersands in the URL, and it showed up with & within the link.  

I typed: [http://www.yahoo.com/blah?hello&goodbye]

The link in the source is: http://www.yahoo.com/blah?hello&amp;goodbye

The link visible to the user is:
http://www.yahoo.com/blah?hello&goodbye

Correct would seem to be:
http://www.yahoo.com/blah?hello&goodbye
fields.summary: ampersand in links breaks them

fields.summary: JDBC error accessing undefined pages on mysql

fields.description:
[A link|http://...] shows "A link".
[A link|query@google] shows "query@google".  

I would rather the second one show "A link" as well.
fields.summary: Shortcuts should allow "my link name" like other links do

fields.description:
According to the docs:
\\ Creates a line break. Not often needed, most of the time Confluence will guess new lines for you appropriately. 

In reality, \\ just shows up as two backslashes on the page.  Which is good if you want to document a Windows Share, but bad if you want to include a line break.  (I'd like linebreaks within table cells, in particular.)
fields.summary: line breaks (\\) don't work

fields.description: We have a table that has links in it. Normal [] links work fine, but [my link name|page] or [link name|key@shortcut] don't work. The table renderer gets confused by the pipe and makes an extra cell, and the link renderer actually includes in the text of the link.
fields.summary: "my link name" links in tables don't work right

fields.description:
We installed confluence on the same server as jira, urls:
http://jira.company.com/jira/...
http://jira.company.com/confluence/...

When we login to one, it logs us out of the other one.  I've even tried making the username and password the same, but that doesn't help.
fields.summary: Confluence Login cookies conflict with JIRA

fields.description:
I tried to get my password email to me on 
http://extranet.atlassian.com:8080/login.action
but i never got an email, it tried to send it based on email too and nothing happend there.

Owen
fields.summary: Email password doesn't seem to work

fields.description:
another macro idea is to parse JUnit XML files and print the results - which would be cacheable

read in from an XML file on disk, or via http remotely and then the results displayed nicely
fields.summary: JUnit XML displaying macro !
